entry.title: Rika Nakagawa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rika Nakagawa (pictured) won a national debate competition as an active tarento?

entry.title: in 1989 the Barcelona women's second football team (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1989 the Barcelona women's second football team was knocked out of the Catalan Cup in the same round as the Barcelona women's first team?

entry.title: Tuhi Martukaw (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tuhi Martukaw led youth delegations to the United Nations Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues for ten years in a row?

entry.title: Smash Hit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that unused placeholder sounds from Smash Hit were reused in Teardown?

entry.title: a Virginia radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that announcers at a Virginia radio station were warned that playing more than three rap songs an hour could get them fired?

entry.title: Edward J. York (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that of the 16 aircraft which took part in the Doolittle Raid, only the one piloted by Edward J. York landed intact?

entry.title: Bed Chem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Bed Chem" and "Juno" are the "horniest" tracks on Short n' Sweet, according to one critic?

entry.title: Moses Benjamin Wulff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Moses Benjamin Wulff founded a printing press that reprinted The Guide for the Perplexed for the first time in centuries?

entry.title: Queens Zoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New York City's Queens Zoo once received a lion cub despite having no lion enclosure?
